title: Inside Zlatan Ibrahimovic's former six-bed mansion still on the market for £4.8million
text:

The spectacular mansion rented by ex-Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic during his time in the north west is on the market - for an eye-watering £4.8million.

The six-bedroom Chesire property, called Green Meadows, stands on an acre of land and boasts four floors as well as six en suites.

In addition, the luxury mansion comes with a gym, bar, wine cellar and games room, and features four reception rooms, a covered terrace and a bespoke security system.

Ibrahimovic paid a reported £30,000-a-month to rent the property, which is currently for sale on the rightmove website, while at Manchester United from 2016 to 2018.

He moved out of the house when leaving the Red Devils for LA Galaxy.

(Image: rightmove)

(Image: rightmove)

Ibrahimovic made 53 appearances in all competitions for Manchester United in the two years he spent at Old Trafford, becoming a fans' favourite in the process.

The Swede was signed by Jose Mourinho when his contract expired at Paris Saint-Germain. The former United boss said of the forward at time: "Zlatan needs no introduction. The statistics speak for themselves. Ibra is one of the best strikers in the world.

"He has won the most important league championships in the world of football, now he has the opportunity to play in the best league in the world and I know he will grasp this opportunity and will work hard to help the team win titles.

(Image: rightmove)

(Image: rightmove)

"I am certain that his talent will delight fans at Old Trafford next season and that his experience will be invaluable in helping to develop the younger players in the squad."

Ibrahimovic added: "I cannot wait to work with Jose Mourinho once again. He is a fantastic manager and I am ready for this new and exciting challenge.

"I have thoroughly enjoyed my career so far and have some great memories. I am now ready to create more special memories in England."

(Image: rightmove)

(Image: rightmove)

Following Ibrahimovic's first season at United the Swedish striker signed a one-year extension before leaving for LA Galaxy in March 2018.

The 38-year-old recently joked that he could return to Old Trafford, saying: "I could easily play in the Premier League, so if United needs me, I'm here."
description: Swedish striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic paid a reported £30,000-a-month to live at the mansion from 2016 to 2018
